article_node.title: Data shows China’s economy lagged in July due to Trump’s tariffs
article_node.summary: China's economy showed signs of slowing in July, with factory output, retail sales, and housing prices declining. Despite a 7.2% year-on-year increase in exports, industrial output growth fell to an 8-month low of 5.7%. The housing market continues to struggle, with property investments down 12% and prices for newly built homes in major cities dropping 1.1%. Overall, economic activity has slowed, impacting consumer spending and increasing the unemployment rate to 5.2%.
